availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Daniel G. Williams (Clay County, Kentucky, farmhand)

body.p: Clay County, Kentucky, farmhand. Kentucky native. Son of Sidney M. Williams and Margaret T. Williams. Resident in Clay County in 1850. Farmhand in Clay County in 1860. Served in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private, second sergeant, first sergeant and captain from September 22, 1861, to September 24, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, Manchester, p. 96B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, Manchester, p. 116.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0219.
Find A Grave, "Daniel G Williams (1842-1899)," Memorial #18257893, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/18257893 (accessed September 14, 2020).
